description.narrative: Bankable engineering plans for demonstration SUT project in Almaty City

comment.narrative: No demonstration projects on sustainable transport
At least 1 demonstration on sustainable transport in Almaty Selection of demonstration project by Year 2 Preparation by Year 3 Implementation Year 4 Operational by Year 5

LRT 1 22 km feasibility study was developed and approved by Municipality
Technical assistance for development of the tender documentation for LRT project via public private partnership PPP scheme was provided
Detailed feasibility study of BRT corridor 1 and detailed design of
BRT 1 line 21 km are under detailed design phase now

description.narrative: Number of financing institutions that commit financing assistance to demonstration SUT

comment.narrative: No financing institutions committed to financing demonstration SUT

LRT project was considered for financing via public private partnership PPP scheme Tender documentation is under development
Akimat committed to finance BRT 1 project

description.narrative: Number of actions to promote public awareness on sustainable transport and CAST project

comment.narrative: No public awareness of Sustainable Transport and CAST project
1 public website and two promo materials about sustainable transport and CAST project designed by Year 1 at least 30 of citizen of Almaty aware about sustainable transport principles by end of Year 3

Project continued distributing information about sustainable transport and green mobility principals through mass media and organized 7 thematic workshops in Almaty
3 information booklets 2 thematic publications 2 translated technical guidelines 2 posters and more than 30 presentations about CAST project objectives and pilots were distributed in frame of 5 international conferences in Almaty 8 presentations were presented at conferences outside of Kazakhstan and in frame of 4 workshops in Astana
Tree types of social advertisement were demonstrated in buses along main transport corridors
Tree cartoons and two social videos to promote green public transport and cycling safety were developed and distributed broadly
Communication with public was organized through regularly updated project web page and pages in social networks Facebook Twitter and Vkontakte Based on media monitoring and reports about distribution of social advertisement at the streets and in the network project estimated that about 30 of citizen of Almaty 05 mln have been informed about key sustainable transport principles

description.narrative: Improved efficiency and quality of public transport services
An optimized public transit route network developed by a transportdemand model

comment.narrative: City public transport network that has poor connections and routings and is not an integrated system

An optimized integrated public transport route network that has been developed by a new Transport Demand Model by Year 2
New version as revised by MTR
An optimized public transit route network that has been developed by a new transport demand model by Year 4

The Transport demand model TDM was designed in order to be capable to forecast travel demand and future performances of highway and public transportation network for years under various scenarios
Daily ridership study for suburb areas and network optimization report were conducted and delivered to municipality New hierarchy was proposed and adjusted via TDM Some routes have already been optimized 11 reorganized 4 cancelled

description.narrative: A holistic and integrated Sustainable Urban Transport Strategy and Action Plan

comment.narrative: Lack of holistic and integrated planning of Sustainable Urban Transport
One integrated Sustainable Urban Transport Strategy and Action Plan approved by Municipality by end of Year 2

The Sustainable urban transport strategy 20132023 document and the Action plan were developed and presented to Municipality The strategy promotes a much more integrated approach linking all modes of transport together and coordinating them with city development This will require close collaboration between all partners This strategy sets new key directions policy targets and plans for the city More than 20 organizations took part in discussions of the policies and related indicators through the experts and stakeholders meetings Key indicators and policies developed under the strategy were recommended to utilize in frame of development of new City master plan 20152035 and transferred for introduction in the City Almaty action plan 20162020 developed by municipality

description.narrative: Number of training programs local conferences and workshops field visits on Sustainable Transport

comment.narrative: Lack of knowledge on sustainable transport policies strategies and projects

1 program to enhance knowledge and skills within the Municipality on Sustainable Transport based on international best practice examples by Year 2
New version as revised per MTR
At least two conferences and two workshops on international best practice examples organized by Year 4

2 international knowledge sharing conferences 115 participants and 3 study tours series of public open lectures were conducted to increase knowledge of policy makers NGOs and scientific institutions about sustainable mobility policies and practices Series of meetings with international experts were organized for local stakeholders 115 representatives of Akimat and scientific institutions were trained regarding modern instruments of transport planning
15 representatives of key partners enhanced knowledge through participation at international conferences on development of green transportation outside of Kazakhstan
Representatives of 6 departments of Akimat and other stakeholders were involved in discussion of the strategy document
Consultations on development of sustainable urban transport projects at local level were delivered to universities and
to Ecoforum Based on materials submitted by experts and coordination with the Ministry of Transport of the Republic of Kazakhstan the Green transport policy concept was presented as one of a chapter and included in the Green Economy Concept adopted by President of Kazakhstan

description.narrative: Investment mobilized in less GHG intensive urban transport

comment.narrative: Moderate investments mobilized for less GHG intensive urban transport
Commitments for additional financing of less GHG intensive urban transport at the amount of USD 100 million by Year 5

USD 745 mln EBRD loan for purchasing modern CNG busses
USD 142 mln EBRD loan for purchasing of new 195 trolleybuses
USD 475 mln Municipal funds spent for purchasing new municipal public transport fleet additional 200 CNG buses 17 trams 200 CNG taxi

description.narrative: Number of new rolling stock procured and operated in the public transport system through old bus exchanges

comment.narrative: No program or plans for modernization of public transport rolling stock of the private sector
200 old buses exchanged for new buses in the private sector by Year 3

600 CNG buses replaced old diesel buses during period 20112015
200 CNG taxi were transferred to the private sector Commitment of Municipality to procure additional 40 modern articulated buses

description.narrative: Number of feasibility studies for the development of sustainable transport improvements that include LRT BRT and feeder routes parking cycling and pedestrian areas

comment.narrative: Piecemeal initiatives for the development of sustainable transport in Almaty
At least 1 feasibility study on developing sustainable transport improvements in Almaty by Year 2

Feasibility study for the Light Rail Tram LRT project in Almaty has been developed by Municipality and will be used for development of PPP LRT tender This study was based on the data and studies collected by the project
BRT prefeasibility study justifies the main BRT corridors and proposes the first BRT line to be developed Municipality financed preparation of full size feasibility study
Detailed design of BRT pilot corridor 1 is under development now

description.narrative: Number of standard public service contracts of international standard to be used for private operators delivering public transport services to Almaty

comment.narrative: No effective standard public service contracts for delivery of public urban transport
One standard public service contract template for developing improvements in public transit in Almaty is available by Year 1

Stakeholders discussed a legal basis of introduction of PSC Introduction of new PSC has been postponed due to delay of introduction of eticketing system and corresponding changes in legislation Stakeholders discussed the subsidies and payment methodology
Operators were requested to sign new contracts in 2016

description.narrative: Number of monitoring systems for tracking reduction of transportrelated GHG and air pollutant emissions

comment.narrative: No monitoring system for tracking GHG or air pollutant emissions from transport in Almaty

1 GHGair pollutant monitoring system software data collection protocols and surveys to measure and report on CAST direct GHG emission impact by Year 2
New version as revised by MTR
GHGair pollutant monitoring system software data collection protocols and surveys to measure and report on CAST direct and indirect GHG emission impact by Year 5

The municipal department of environmental protection was equipped by the GHG calculation model and methodology of data collection Local experts were trained on calculation of transport related emissions
Methodology was introduced to governmental agencies Recommendations on improvement of monitoring of transport related emissions to improve data collection were developed and presented to governmental agencies

description.narrative: Number of trainees on the operation and maintenance of new public transport rolling stock

comment.narrative: No trained drivers and mechanics on the operation and maintenance of public transport rolling stock
50 trainees on the operation and maintenance of new buses and refuelling infrastructure by Year 2

20 bus technicians were trained on operation and maintenance of CNG buses To increase sustainability of the training programme additional 6 teachers and 4 last year students were trained for development of the course on maintenance of CNG transport
CNG safety guidelines were developed and 1000 copies were distributed among drivers
Ecodriving course was developed and transferred to 31 local instructors for further implementation

One study and expected subsidies to sustain public transport quality in Almaty City by Year 3

CAST project conducted 2 trainings and presented best international practice to increase capacity of 42 municipalitytransport authority staff to discuss and design subsidy policy
Specific Fare system study was proposed to conduct in 2016
Regulatory changes for subsidies have been analyzed and recommendations have been developed

description.narrative: Integrated traffic management
Number of traffic management schemes planned

comment.narrative: Ad hoc measures taken to improve traffic flows in Almaty

2 traffic management schemes by Year 3
New version as revised per MTR
One traffic management schemes developed by Year 4

Concept of implementation of new traffic management scheme discussed with Municipality Development postponed until finalizing of the City Master plan in 2016 Municipality requested to allocate cofinance for road traffic data collection before initiation of traffic management scheme proposal

description.narrative:
Number of paid parking schemes for Almaty planned

comment.narrative: No paid parking schemes being planned

New version as revised per MTR
1 plan paid parking schemes in downtown core of Almaty and enforcement of parking restrictions in selected areas of Almaty by Year 4

International experience in implementation of parking policy was presented to public municipality and parliamentarian
The package of documents including the Parking Policy document the Operational Guidelines and recommendations for amendments to the legislation were developed and transferred to Municipality Importance of the institutional reform in parking management was highlighted to Mayor
Institutional changes and reorganization of the municipal parking company as a sustainable basis for development of pilots are under discussion Some legislation changes for enforcement of paid parking have been approved

Proposals for extension of cycling corridors for city center were developed and transferred to municipality
20 representatives of design companies state construction expertise agency and public organizations obtained new knowledge about cycling inclusive infrastructure design The bike safety school and printing of several posters were supported in order to train young cyclists reduce traffic accidents and promote safe driving Development of conceptual design of city center reconstruction was taken into account with commitment of Municipality to create pedestrian and traffic calming zones
